org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.storage.aws
Class EbsStorageDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.storage.BaseStorageDriver
      org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.storage.aws.EbsStorageDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
StorageProvisioningDriver
public class EbsStorageDriver
extends BaseStorageDriver
implements StorageProvisioningDriver

An implementation of elastic block Store storage driver. In-order to attach a storage volume to a specific machine, the storage volume and the machine must be in the same availability zone and a device name for the specific machines kernel should be set.

Since:
2.5.0
Author:
adaml
See Also:
formatting and mounting of the volume will be done using the bootstrap-management script., http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ebs-using-volumes.html

Parameters:

                                  String availabilityZone,
                                  long duration,
                                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
                           throws TimeoutException,
                                  StorageProvisioningException
Specified by:
createVolume in interface StorageProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
templateName - The name of the template to be used when starting a new volume.
availabilityZone - The location where the storage volume will be created.
duration - duration until times out.
timeUnit - the duration timeout units.
Returns:
volume details object
Throws:
TimeoutException - if execution exceeds duration.
StorageProvisioningException - on storage creation error. any started volumes will be removed.

Specified by:
attachVolume in interface StorageProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
volumeId - the ID of the volume that will attach instance.
device - the device name of the storage volume.
ip - the designated machine instance IP for attaching the volume.
duration - duration until times out.
timeUnit - the duration timeout units.
Throws:
TimeoutException - if execution exceeds duration.
StorageProvisioningException - if volume is already attached, volume and machine not in same location etc.
